repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: An artificial collection, identified by format, documenting University of Connecticut events, particularly athletic activities, from 1969-2012.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: In April 1881, the Connecticut General Assembly established the Storrs Agricultural School after accepting a gift of 170 acres of land, several frame buildings, and money from Charles and Augustus Storrs. The School opened on 28 September 1881, with twelve students in the first class. Before the turn of the century there were two name changes ( Storrs Agricultural College 1893, Connecticut Agricultural College 1899). In 1933, two years after the institution celebrated its fiftieth anniversary, it became Connecticut State College, a name more in keeping with its steady advances and broadened mission. Six years later, in 1939, the General Assembly designated the institution the University of Connecticut, an acknowledgment of the institution's developing importance to the State in graduate and professional education, research and public service.

When Connecticut Agricultural College became Connecticut State College in 1933, the institution’s athletic teams could no longer be called "Aggies." The following year, the student newspaper, The Connecticut Campus, conducted a student survey to select a mascot. The top choice was the husky dog. A student contest resulted in naming the dog "Jonathan" for Jonathan Trumbull, Connecticut's Revolutionary War-era governor.

The first Jonathan was a black and white husky. However, all subsequent dogs have been all-white. UConn’s current mascot is Jonathan XIII. The husky dog was immortalized on the Storrs campus in 1995 with a statue by artist Larry Waisele. The statue is a popular photo spot. Students often rub the nose of the statue for good luck. A costumed mascot inspires school spirit at UConn athletic events and other campus activities.

The University of Connecticut Division of Athletics now oversees and organizes both men's and woman's sports, including: Baseball, Basketball, Cross Country, Football, Golf, Ice Hockey, Soccer, Swimming & Diving, Tennis, Track & Field, Field Hockey, Lacrosse, Rowing, Softball, and Volleyball.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Posters have been collected, transferred and/or donated by University faculty, staff, students and members of the wider community periodically.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], University Poster Collection. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains four folders of posters used for advertising University of Connecticut events, particularly athletic activities, from 1969-2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: The Women's Basketball file contains an assortment of posters ; ranging from season schedules to championship victories. Smaller posters featuring Kaili Mclaren, Willnett Crockett, and Tahirah Williams can be found in this collection.]

did.abstract: The Men's Basketball Poster collection includes season schedules and promotional materials. This collection ranges from 1969 to 2009. It includesthe 2005 Calhoun Hall of Fame induction, as well as, the Men's All Century team.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: The Men's Basketball Poster collection includes season schedules and promotional materials. This collection ranges from 1969 to 2009. It includesthe 2005 Calhoun Hall of Fame induction, as well as, the Men's All Century team.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: athletic posters (except Basketball) including football schedules, soccer posters, and Husky pride signs.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Subjects include: UConn athlete height including Renee Montgomery, Maya Moore, Svetlana Abrosimova, Rudy Gay, AJ Price, Swin Cash, Emeka Okafor, Ben Gordon, and Dan Orlovsky.]

did.abstract: This collection includes event posters on the Uconn Storrs campus between 1974 and 2011, excluding Exhibits in Homer and the Nature and Enviroment series.
